revised_title: Meteorological Observations in Balloon Ascents and Their Implications
tldr: The author, John Welsh, describes four balloon ascents conducted under the direction of the Kew Observatory Committee to investigate meteorological changes with elevation. Observations reveal that temperature progression is not regular at all heights, with a certain height range exhibiting a constant or slightly increasing temperature before resuming its downward course. The study also notes the existence of moisture in the atmosphere, which may affect temperature changes.
